014package org.jdbi.v3.core.internal;
015
016import org.antlr.v4.runtime.CharStream;
017import org.antlr.v4.runtime.Token;
018import org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.SqlScriptLexer;
019import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.internal.ErrorListener;
020
021import static org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.SqlScriptLexer.BLOCK_BEGIN;
022import static org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.SqlScriptLexer.BLOCK_END;
023import static org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.SqlScriptLexer.COMMENT;
024import static org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.SqlScriptLexer.LITERAL;
025import static org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.SqlScriptLexer.MULTI_LINE_COMMENT;
026import static org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.SqlScriptLexer.NEWLINES;
027import static org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.SqlScriptLexer.OTHER;
028import static org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.SqlScriptLexer.QUOTED_TEXT;
029import static org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.lexer.SqlScriptLexer.SEMICOLON;
030
031/**
032 * An SQL script parser.
033 *
034 * <p>It performs lexical analysis of a script and generates events for semicolons.
035 * As a result it returns a script without comments and newlines.</p>
036 */
037public class SqlScriptParser {
038
039    private final TokenHandler semicolonHandler;
040
041    public SqlScriptParser(TokenHandler semicolonHandler) {
042        this.semicolonHandler = semicolonHandler;
043    }
044
045    public String parse(CharStream charStream) {
046        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
047        SqlScriptLexer lexer = new SqlScriptLexer(charStream);
048        lexer.addErrorListener(new ErrorListener());
049        boolean endOfFile = false;
050        int blockLevel = 0;
051        while (!endOfFile) {
052            Token t = lexer.nextToken();
053            switch (t.getType()) {
054                case Token.EOF:
055                    endOfFile = true;
056                    break;
057                case SEMICOLON:
058                    if (blockLevel == 0) {
059                        semicolonHandler.handle(t, sb);
060                    } else {
061                        // preserve semicolons within begin/end block
062                        sb.append(t.getText());
063                    }
064                    break;
065                case BLOCK_BEGIN:
066                case BLOCK_END:
067                    blockLevel += BLOCK_BEGIN == t.getType() ? +1 : -1;
068                    sb.append(t.getText());
069                    break;
070                case COMMENT:
071                case MULTI_LINE_COMMENT:
072                    break;
073                case NEWLINES:
074                    if (sb.length() > 0) {
075                        sb.append('\n');
076                    }
077                    break;
078                case QUOTED_TEXT:
079                case LITERAL:
080                case OTHER:
081                    sb.append(t.getText());
082                    break;
083                default:
084                    throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unrecognizable token " + t);
085            }
086        }
087        return sb.toString();
088    }
089
090    public interface TokenHandler {
091        void handle(Token t, StringBuilder sb);
092    }
093}
